Description: Lip and body sherd (mended from three fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery lotus bowl; brown clay with white inclusions; glaze fired dark inside, red-brown outside glazed; narrow band at top; in frieze, vertical to left of pendant lotus flower; two lines and a band below; inscription cut on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 291)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 667, no. 252)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.588)
